sentences: Hän otti riskin ja hyppäsi mereen.
context: The Finnish verb 'ottaa' is a very common and versatile word that primarily means 'to take'. However, it has many other uses depending on the context. It can also mean to receive, accept, get or catch something. The form 'ottaa' is the present tense third-person singular indicative form, but it’s also the basic form of the verb used in dictionaries.  The word conjugates based on person and tense as shown in the dictionary definitions.
